meanings.definition: Behaving in a mischievous or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The rascally squirrel stole all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled at the rascally puppy playing in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The rascally cat knocked over the flower pot and then tried to look innocent.
meanings.sent4: His rascally smile gave away his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The rascally student kept passing notes during class, causing a distraction.

meanings.sent1: The rascally fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was being rascally when he kept changing his story.
meanings.sent3: The rascally magician amazed the audience with his clever illusions.
meanings.sent4: Her rascally behavior made it hard to trust her.
meanings.sent5: The rascally salesman convinced people to buy things they didn't need.

meanings.sent1: The little rascally was always getting into trouble at school.
meanings.sent2: The town had its fair share of rascally characters causing chaos.
meanings.sent3: The rascally pickpocket was finally caught by the police.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the rascally con artist who preys on unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The old man told stories of the rascally pirates he encountered in his youth.
